means: 捕蟹( crab的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: His mature composi tions are generally considered the more cerebral and crabbed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他成熟的作品一般被认为是触动理智的和难于理解的.

sentence.Network_en: He met a crabbed, cantankerous director.
sentence.Network_cn: 他碰上了一位坏脾气、爱争吵的主管。

sentence.Network_en: The crabbed, patient experimenting of these Arab alchemists spread into the Christian world.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些阿拉伯炼金术士难以捉摸、坚韧不拔的实验方法传人基督教世界.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'perverse, wayward'): from crab, because of the crab's sideways gait and habit of snapping, thought to suggest a perverse or irritable disposition
